content: this legal case involves a dispute over a property located in vrap de novo the court has made a decision to dissolve the coownership of the property based on article 50 of the law the court found that the applicant had valid reasons to claim the entire property due to deteriorated building elements and potential dangers the court also determined the value of the property and the coownership shares of the parties involved the court ordered the termination of coownership and the payment process with costs divided proportionally among the coowners the court also discussed the appointment of a temporary representative and awarded a fee to the representative the counterpartys appeal was partially rejected while the applicants appeal was partially accepted the court upheld the decision of the court of first instance regarding the adjustments to the temporary representatives costs
